alert.note: Alert for Churchill; Lyon; Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 10 at 5:35PM PST until January 10 at 7:30PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Churchill County in west central Nevada... Mineral County in western Nevada... Lyon County in west central Nevada... * Until 730 PM PST. * At 531 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line along the Highway 50 corridor east of Stagecoach moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Expect deteriorated road conditions along US-95 Alt, US-50 from Stagecoach to Middlegate, US-95 from Fallon to Mina, and SR-208 to Smith Valley. Locations impacted include... Lahontan Reservoir, Hawthorne, Yerington, Luning, Mina, Wabuska, Silver Springs, Smith, Fort Churchill Station, Mason, Walker Lake, Weed Heights, Mina Airport, Junction U.S 50 And NV 839, Junction Nv 339 And Nv 208, Schurz, Nv 361 At Mineral-Nye Co Line South Of Gabbs), Rawhide, and Hawthorne Industrial Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze and remain hazardous after the snow decreases in intensity. Slow Down and turn on headlights! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
